products.name: deploy-arch-landing-zone-code-engine
products.label: Landing zone for serverless workloads with IBM Code Engine
products.short_description: Provision scalable, serverless workloads with integrated IBM Cloud services.
products.long_description:
This solution enables the provisioning of [IBM Code Engine](https://www.ibm.com/products/code-engine) projects on IBM Cloud using a range of configurations—from compute-intensive workloads to future support for broader serverless patterns. Each variation offers a distinct balance of automation, integration with IBM Cloud services, and readiness for experimentation or production use. 

The current variation supports high-performance tasks like Monte Carlo simulations, PDF conversion with Doclin, and batch processing using VPC and COS. 

It automates both Code Engine setup and the supporting IBM Cloud infrastructure for full end-to-end deployment. Whether you're running intensive jobs or exploring other serverless architectures, this landing zone helps accelerate your cloud-native journey.

features.title: Flexible Deployment Variations
features.description: Supports a growing set of configurations tailored to specific workload types—from compute-intensive tasks to future support for event-driven jobs and transactional applications.

features.title: End-to-End Automation
features.description: Provisions both IBM Code Engine components (applications, builds, secrets, access policies) and supporting IBM Cloud infrastructure for a complete deployment experience.

features.title: IBM Cloud Service Integrations
features.description: Seamless integration with Secrets Manager, Container Registry, Activity Tracker, IBM Cloud Logs, and IBM Cloud Monitoring.

features.title: Simplified Setup with Guided Inputs
features.description: Preconfigured defaults and guided parameter selection (e.g., region, availability zones, service plans) reduce manual setup and accelerate deployment.

products.support_details: This product is in the community registry, as such support is handled through the originated repo. If you experience issues please open an issue in that repository [https://github.com/terraform-ibm-modules/terraform-ibm-code-engine/issues](https://github.com/terraform-ibm-modules/terraform-ibm-code-engine/issues). Please note this product is not supported via the IBM Cloud Support Center.

iam_permissions.notes: Viewer access is required in the resource group you want to provision in.

features.description: Ideal for users with existing container images who want to quickly deploy applications without rebuilding.
Enables fast, simple deployment by using pre-built images to speed up rollout.

diagram.caption: IBM Cloud Code Engine Application Topology

diagrams.description:
This architecture provides a streamlined setup within an IBM Cloud region to deploy and manage serverless applications using Code Engine. It includes a Code Engine project, application, and registry secret as core components enabling secure container image management and seamless app deployment.

Optional integrations include observability tools like Cloud Monitoring and Cloud Logs for real-time insights into application performance and health. Additional services such as App Configuration (separate from Code Engine apps), SCC Workload Protection, and Activity Tracker enhance configuration management, security, and auditing.

Designed for simplicity and flexibility, this solution accelerates the deployment and operational management of scalable, event-driven applications on IBM Cloud.

configuration.description: To manage platform logs that are generated by IBM Cloud services in a region of IBM Cloud, you must create a tenant in each region that you operate. Pass a list of regions to create a tenant in. [Learn more](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/logs-router?topic=logs-router-about-platform-logs).

When set to `true`, the IBM Cloud Monitoring instance will be configured to collect platform metrics from the provided region. You can configure 1 instance only of the IBM Cloud Monitoring service per region to collect platform metrics in that location. Check with the account or service administrator if another monitoring instance has already been configured. You may not have permissions to see all monitoring instances in the region. [Learn more](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/monitoring?topic=monitoring-platform_metrics_enabling).

dependencies.description: Cloud automation for Account Configuration organizes your IBM Cloud account with a ready-made set of resource groups by default and when you enable the "with Account Settings" option, it also applies baseline security and governance settings.

features.description: Ideal for users who want to build container images directly from source code and immediately run them.
Provides an integrated build-and-run workflow for fast development and testing cycles.

diagram.caption: IBM Cloud Code Engine Build and Runtime Topology

diagrams.description:
This deployable architecture enables the building, running, and management of container images within an IBM Cloud region using IBM Cloud Code Engine. It provisions a Code Engine project with associated build configurations and registry secrets, along with access to IBM Cloud Container Registry for secure image storage and management.

Optional integrations include Cloud Monitoring and Cloud Logs for observability, while Activity Tracker, App Configuration, and SCC Workload Protection enhance security, auditing, and configuration management.

Designed for simplicity and flexibility, this solution accelerates the build, run, and operational management of scalable, event-driven workloads on IBM Cloud.

configuration.description: To manage platform logs that are generated by IBM Cloud services in a region of IBM Cloud, you must create a tenant in each region that you operate. Pass a list of regions to create a tenant in. [Learn more](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/logs-router?topic=logs-router-about-platform-logs).

When set to `true`, the IBM Cloud Monitoring instance will be configured to collect platform metrics from the provided region. You can configure 1 instance only of the IBM Cloud Monitoring service per region to collect platform metrics in that location. Check with the account or service administrator if another monitoring instance has already been configured. You may not have permissions to see all monitoring instances in the region. [Learn more](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/monitoring?topic=monitoring-platform_metrics_enabling).

features.description: Ideal for users who want an end-to-end flow that builds from source, runs the image, and deploys the application.
Streamlines development with a single workflow for building, testing, and deploying applications quickly.

diagram.caption: IBM Cloud Code Engine QuickStart Topology

diagrams.description:
This architecture defines a streamlined environment within an IBM Cloud region that includes a Code Engine project with associated builds, an application, and a registry secret. It supports secure building and running of containerized workloads.

The setup also includes an IBM Cloud Container Registry for reliable storage and management of container images.

Designed for simplicity and flexibility, this setup enables efficient build processes and container image management to support scalable, event-driven workloads on IBM Cloud.

iam_permissions.notes: Viewer access is required in the resource group you want to provision in.
Required for creating container registry namespaces.
Required for creating Virtual Server Instance and Virtual Private Cloud(VPC).
[Optional] Required if Cloud automation for account configuration is enabled.
[Optional] Required if you are enabling Cloud monitoring.
[Optional] Required if you are enabling Cloud logs.

features.description: Ideal for users running distributed container-based tasks with minimal setup, such as Monte Carlo simulations, PDF conversion with Doclin, or batch processing with VPC and COS integration.

Automates deployment of a scalable Code Engine Fleet with integrated IBM Cloud services. Guided inputs for region, zones, and service plans—plus preconfigured defaults—enable a ready-to-run environment for execution, storage, and observability, without manual networking or service setup.

diagram.caption: Fleet-Based Workload Topology with IBM Cloud Code Engine

diagrams.description:
This architecture provides a streamlined setup within an IBM Cloud region to deploy and manage fleet-based workloads using IBM Cloud Code Engine. It introduces a Fleet managed by Code Engine as the core execution environment, with worker instances (VSIs) dynamically provisioned in Code Engine–managed accounts based on a customer-provided VSI image.

A Task State Store, implemented using IBM Cloud Object Storage (COS), handles task and data persistence. Logs generated by the fleet workers are ingested into an IBM Cloud Logs instance, enabling centralized observability and simplified monitoring.

Designed for scalability and operational efficiency, this Quick Start automates the provisioning of required IBM Cloud services using well-chosen defaults. Users provide minimal input—such as region, availability zones, and service plans—while Code Engine handles the lifecycle of Fleets, Tasks, and Workers.

This solution accelerates deployment of distributed, container-based workloads without requiring manual setup of networking, storage, or observability components, making it ideal for rapid experimentation and workload execution on IBM Cloud.

value_constraints.description: Prefix must begin with a lowercase letter and may contain only lowercase letters, digits, and hyphens '-'. It must not end with a hyphen('-')

options.displayname: Graduated tier Sysdig Secure plus Monitor
